labels.text: The artist encountered this partially built twostorey building by chance while travelling in Cambodia, and named it The Ghost House after seeing the dangling construction tape eerily moving in the wind. It is one of several photographs he took in Southeast Asia as part of a series that documents lanwei or ‘broken tail’ architecture—development projects that for some reason have not been completed and remain in the landscape as mysterious half-built structures. Wong began photographing such buildings in 2006 in the southern Chinese cities of Guangzhou

labels.text: 藝術家在一次柬埔寨之行途中，偶遇照片中樓高 兩層的建築。施工用的帶子從棄置工地垂下，隨 風飄揚，形態詭異，於是將之命名為「 鬼屋」。又 一山人以「 爛尾樓」為題拍攝了一系列照片。而這 作品取自他在東南亞時拍攝的照片。「 爛尾樓」， 顧名思義是指因工程半途中止而荒廢在原地的未 完成建築物。又一山人由 2006 年起拍攝廣州及上 海等中國南方城市的建築。隨着東南亞的經濟下 滑，他感興趣的創作範疇迅即遍及當地，為其大 型攝影創作提供大量拍攝素材。

images.AltText: Photograph of an empty abandoned building. The building is completely missing all of its walls and roof. Dozens of white strands of some type of material hang down from the ceilings.
images.AltTextTC: 照片中是一幢中空的廢棄建築物，沒有任何牆壁，也沒有屋頂。幾十條白色的穗狀物料，從樓頂垂墜下來。
